result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Peters, Branden D
defendant.address: 420 S Boulder Ridge Dr, Lake Geneva, WI 53147

records.addlTxt: ADA Berg appears for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Brad Lochowicz appears. Defendant not in court. Defendant is in custody at DCI. Trial dates to be coordinated via email with attorneys.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Branden D Peters in court, in custody.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Branden D Peters. Case to be re-assigned and trial dates set. Minutes filed.

Defendant Branden D Peters in court, in custody. Attorney Keith Venema for Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Branden D Peters. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. State waiting for blood. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Branden D Peters in court in custody by video.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Branden D Peters. Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
3:05 PM Defendant Branden D Peters in custody and appeared via video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin DAA Sempf  in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Branden D Peters. 
State called to the stand as a witness, Deputy Patrick Storm.
Patrick Storm duly sworn by the clerk, testified on direct examination by DDA Sempf. Witness identified the defendant in court on video.
3:16PM - Cross examination by Attorney Lochowicz.
3:18PM - Argument by DAA Sempf.
3:20 PM - Argument by Attorney Lochowicz.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 

State is requesting  a couple of weeks for Arraignment Hearing.

Adj. 3:22 PM

8:41 AM Case called. Defendant Branden D Peters in court, in custody appeared by video.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Branden D Peters. Attorney Vivien TenHaken for the state. 
Defendant understands charges, reading waived. Rights given and hearing within time limits. 
Prelim hearing set for April 25, 2022 @ 3pm, 3036.

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Branden D Peters in court, in custody by video. Referred to SPD. Does qualify for SPD. To call back today. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Branden D Peters in court, in custody by video. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. MUST COMPLY WITH ANY IID ORDERS. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Branden D Peters in court, in custody by video. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Defendant requests lower cash bond. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

J.J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Branden Daniel Peters in court, in custody by video with Attorney Daane. Called at 1:43 PM. Matter before the court for bond, record by court as to history. Can hear bond but will recuse on any future hearings. Court addresses defendant as to his wishes. Defendant asks that Judge recuse. Court recuses on this matter and will not hear. Bond hearing continued. Minutes filed.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
